title.narrative: OUTPUT 7: RURAL SANITATION

description.narrative: Capacity of Government is improved to implement the Rural Sanitation Model and Strategy to generate demand and facilitate supply, which contributes to Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: More children and their families have access to basic sanitation, supported by more effective national strategies

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Capacity of Government is improved to implement the Rural Sanitation Model and Strategy to generate demand and facilitate supply

description.narrative: 2020 activities are focused on strengthening the enabling environment for sanitation. These include a review of the eight-year-old Rural Sanitation Model and Strategy, an assessment of sanitation financing approaches to support sector decision making on financing the SDGs and Public Advocacy on the Open Defecation Free Ghana agenda. UNICEF continues to support the modeling of ODF interventions at community level activities with 146 ODF communities out of the annual target of 250. These include four small towns with population above 2000. These serve as models for achieving ODF in larger communities making it possible to achieve district wide ODF status. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/12/2019
